conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, analyze the position-time (x-t) graph.
The speed of the car can be calculated by finding the slope of the x-t graph.
The graph shows a straight line starting from the point (-2, 0) and passing through the point (0, 10).
The car's motion is linear during this phase.
The slope of a line in a position-time graph is given by the formula: slope = Δx/Δt.
The line passes through the points (-2, 0) and (0, 10).
Using the slope formula: slope = 10 meters / 2 seconds = 5 m/s.
This slope represents the speed of the car.
Since the graph is a straight line, the speed is constant throughout this phase.
The speed at the end of the 2nd second is the same as the slope of the line.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
